article: Middle school students today may behave surprisingly. Are you often _ of them? My daughter (12 yo, 7th grade) is on the cross-country team at her middle school. As with any _ , the cross-country team has its "stars" as well as its less _ athletes. Ethan, Michael (8th grade) and Kenji (7th grade) are the _ runners for the boys. Yesterday was the first track meet of the season, and when she got home, my daughter told me a story that made me _ . According to my daughter, one of the new 6th graders is a boy named Albert. He is apparently "a little short and 41 _ " and has never played any _ races before. The 6th graders ran last, three laps around the school. 43 _ in the race, Albert was dead last. All of the other racers were _ the race when he was just at the end of his second lap. Albert thought he was _ near the end. But quickly the poor kid realized that he had another whole lap left to run. He broke down and started _ . When Ethan, Michael, and Kenji saw Albert in a _ mood in the middle of the field, they didn't even _ . All three of them immediately went out on the field to run Albert's last lap _ him. Everyone knew that was _ the rules in cross country, yet they all remained _ . Both other teams hung around and waited for Albert to finish. When he managed to _ the finish line, all three schools cheered for him. After my daughter told me this sweet story I said, "I hope Albert doesn't _ the team after this." She replied, "No! He'll get better, he just needs some _ ." And that is why I _ middle school children.
